## Data frame

```{r}
data(iris)
View(iris)
str(iris)

dim(iris)
```


### Subsetting data frame

```{r}
colnames(iris)
row.names(iris)

# Particular column
iris$Species
iris[ ,5 ]

# Particular cell
iris[1,2]

# Particular row
iris[10, ]

l[[3]] <- iris
str(l)

l <- list()
l[[1]] <- iris$Sepal.Length
l[[2]] <- iris$Sepal.Width
l[[3]] <- iris
str(l)

l[[1]][2]
l[[2]][2]

# getting the species column from the 3rd element of the list
l[[3]][, 5]
```

## Factor

```{r}
unique(iris$Species)
class(iris$Species)
levels(iris$Species)

myiris <- split(iris, iris$Species)


```

## Looping

```{r}
for (i in 1:length(myiris) ) {
  df <- myiris[[i]]
  print (mean( df$Sepal.Length))
}
mean()
```

### Apply family

```{r}

# lapply
results <- lapply( myiris, function(x) {
  mean(x$Sepal.Length)
} )  

results[[1]]
results[["setosa"]]

# apply
apply_result <- apply(iris[ , c(1:4)], MARGIN = 2, mean)
apply_result
```
